result.markdown:
--- title: "Checking E. tourneforti geographical distribution; Subsampling" author: "Kathleen Durkin" date: "2025-07-08" categories: ["SIFP_2025"] format: html bibliography: ../../../references.bib --- ### E. tourneforti geographic distribution I want to get a sense of where the E.tourneforti specimens were collected, since we ideally want to be sequencing specimens from roughly the same location. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # Load library(dplyr) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Attaching package: 'dplyr' ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': filter, lag ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` The following objects are masked from 'package:base': intersect, setdiff, setequal, union ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} library(ggplot2) library(tidygeocoder) library(maps) library(leaflet) library(RColorBrewer) Eunicea <- read.csv("./data/Eunicea_nmnhsearch-20250707190456.csv") # format data # Extract year from the inconsistently formatted "Date.Collected" column # This command should just extract the first 4-digit number in each entry Eunicea$Year.Collected <- as.numeric(sub(".*(\\d{4}).*", "\\1", Eunicea$Date.Collected)) # Reduce scientifc names to just species names cleaned_Eunicea <- gsub("\\s*\\([^\\)]+\\)", "", Eunicea$Scientific.Name) Eunicea$Species.Clean <- sub("^((\\S+)\\s+(\\S+)).*$", "\\1", cleaned_Eunicea) # Grab just E. tourneforti E_tourneforti <- Eunicea[Eunicea$Species.Clean == "Eunicea tourneforti",] # Make a location variable which includes both country and state # If country was not listed, use the "Precise Locality" (E.g., Navassa Island, NW Point) E_tourneforti$Location <- ifelse( E_tourneforti$Country != "", paste0(E_tourneforti$Country, ", ", E_tourneforti$Province.State ), paste0(E_tourneforti$Precise.Locality) ) ``` ::: Plot geographic distribution of collections ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # From collection locations (e.g., "Bermuda"), get coordinates E_tourneforti_coords <- E_tourneforti %>% geocode(Location, method = "osm", lat = Location.Lat, long = Location.Lon) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Passing 23 addresses to the Nominatim single address geocoder ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Query completed in: 24 seconds ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # Need to manually set the coordinates for Navassa Island E_tourneforti_coords$Location.Lat[grepl("Navassa Island", E_tourneforti_coords$Location)] <- 18.410281 E_tourneforti_coords$Location.Lon[grepl("Navassa Island", E_tourneforti_coords$Location)] <- -75.011887 # Bin years by decade, for ease of mapping E_tourneforti_coords$Decade.Collected <- floor(E_tourneforti_coords$Year.Collected / 10) * 10 # Group collections by location and decade Et_summary <- E_tourneforti_coords %>% group_by(Decade.Collected, Location, Location.Lat, Location.Lon) %>% summarise(n = n(), .groups = "drop") ``` ::: Ggplot map ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} world_map <- map_data("world") ggplot() + geom_polygon(data = world_map, aes(x = long, y = lat, group = group), fill = "gray95", color = "gray80") + geom_point(data = Et_summary, aes(x = Location.Lon, y = Location.Lat, size = n, color = as.factor(Decade.Collected)), alpha = .9) + # geom_text(data = Et_summary, # aes(x = Location.Lon, y = Location.Lat, label = Location), # vjust = -2, size = 2) + scale_size_continuous(name = "Sample count") + scale_color_viridis_d(name = "Decade Collected") + coord_fixed(xlim = c(-90, -58), ylim = c(4, 30), ratio = 1.3) + theme_minimal() + labs(title = "Sample Collection Locations by Decade") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning: Removed 5 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range (`geom_point()`). ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](2025_07_08_specimen_selection2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: Also wanted to try out `leaflet`, which supports interactive maps ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # Create a color palette for discrete years year_levels <- sort(unique(Et_summary$Decade.Collected)) #pal <- colorFactor(rainbow(length(year_levels)), domain = year_levels) #pal <- colorNumeric(palette = "YlGnBl", domain = year_levels) pal <- colorFactor( #palette = c("steelblue3", "limegreen" , "gold"), palette = c("purple3", "red2", "gold"), domain = year_levels, levels = year_levels ) # Build the leaflet map leaflet(data = Et_summary) %>% addTiles() %>% setView(lng = -75, lat = 20, zoom = 5) %>% # Center on Caribbean addCircleMarkers( lng = ~Location.Lon, lat = ~Location.Lat, radius = ~sqrt(n) * 3, color = ~pal(Decade.Collected), stroke = FALSE, fillOpacity = 0.8, label = ~paste0(Location, "
Year: ", Decade.Collected, "
n = ", n), popup = ~paste0("Location: ", Location, "
Year: ", Decade.Collected, "
Samples: ", n) ) %>% addLegend("bottomright", pal = pal, values = ~Decade.Collected, title = "Decade Collected", opacity = 1) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
``` ::: ::: All specimens were collected in the Caribbean. Both the oldest and most recent collections appear to have been performed around the Florida keys and Bahamas, so I'd like to prioritize subsampling mid-age (1960s-1970s) specimens that were also collected from that area. ### First subsampling: Cleaned benchtop and gloves with bleach. Cleaned tools with bleach wipe, then DI wipe, then 95% EtoH wipe between each sample. To subsample, cut a \~2mm thick round from one stalk of the specimen. I Since these three specimens were quite thick, this yielded a fair amount of tissue. May need to cut longer sections for thin specimens (including, most likely, the modern ones). Chose 3 large specimens from the 1960s as the first, since this decade has abundant and large collected specimens (just in case I took too much material while I'm still refamiliarizing myself). **Catalog numbers:** USNM 51732\ USNM 51728\ USNM 51730 ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} subsampled <- c("USNM 51732", "USNM 51728", "USNM 51730") E_tourneforti %>% filter(Catalog.Number %in% subsampled) %>% select(Catalog.Number, Species.Clean, Location, Year.Collected) %>% print() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Catalog.Number Species.Clean Location Year.Collected 1 USNM 51728 Eunicea tourneforti United States, Florida 1960 2 USNM 51730 Eunicea tourneforti Bermuda, 1960 3 USNM 51732 Eunicea tourneforti Bermuda, 1960 ``` ::: :::
